name: Sheraton Saigon Hotel & Towers

reviews.text: the best hotel of our trip. we look forward to coming back in the near future with my big family.
reviews.title: Great hotel in sai gon

reviews.text: We visted the hotel for the New Year. On check out it became apparent that the hotel had damaged our property. The staff then tried to cover up the damage they had done. They then told seniors lies about our check out time. Staff in Singapore were unhelpful when we complianed. They promised to get back to us and haven't. The whole experience was way below the strandards of a five star hotel. I really can not sya a good thing about the experience. You can judge a hotel on how they deal with complaints, and when things go wrong. Sheraton falls well short.
reviews.title: I will never use Sheraton again

reviews.text: Good view, very convinent , very clean.
reviews.title: Excellent Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staf is so friendly and professional.
reviews.title: Excellent bar with view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very good food.
reviews.title: Perfect Stay in Saigon

reviews.text: While the location is great the old tower is just that... OLD. My first room smelled like a basement and when I mentioned it they offered me a room in the Grand Tower for $75 more a night. I went in the saw the room... while it was quite nice... it was NOT worth the extra money. This hotel is the WORST Sheraton Hotel I have ever been to in Asia. Not only was the hotel just OLD the service was terrible. The concierge could not suggest any restaurants and could hardly speak English. He also seemed to careless about helping us. I am VERY disappointed in this hotel and would suggest people stay other places if they want true service. I could have overlooked the oldness of the hotel if the service was what a "5 star" hotel should be. I am a starwood platinum member and very rarely leave a property unhappy. I felt like this hotel should be in a smaller city in the middle of the US not in Asia where most hotels of this level have incredible service.
reviews.title: Would not stay again... not in the Grand Tower or Regular Tower

reviews.text: we chose the hotel because it was close to shops and sights. The rooms were however tired and need refurbishment. The breakfast was substandard and the breakfast room staff surly. It was not the standard one would expect for an expensive hotel.
reviews.title: stay only if you want a convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Grand Tower is one of the two towers at the Sheraton Saigon. I found it to be newly decorated and carpeted and the Suite we stayed in was outstanding, for comfort, amenities, cleanliness and level of service received.
reviews.title: Oasis of calm and luxury in a bustling vibrant and exciting city

reviews.text: The Towers lounge was well stocked and the staff particularly attentive. The evening canapes were more like meals and breakfast in the Towers lounge was smooth.
reviews.title: Good Value, but noisy

reviews.text: The gym is very well equipped for a hotel gym and although the pool is not massive, it is surrounded by loungers and nearby both the gym and the lounge.
reviews.title: Outdated hotel wih poor service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked 2 nights on our aeroplan points. We must have been in the older tower, but our room was nonetheless very nice, much better than I was expecting. The bathroom was very large and clean, separate tub and shower stall. Compared to the Caravelle, which we stayed for 2 nights afterwards, I much preferred the Sheraton.
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for 2 nights with my husband as part of our honeymoon. We chose to stay here because we are Starwood Gold members, but would not likely stay here again.
reviews.title: Mediocre in every way

reviews.text: Check-in was slow, and we were told there were no available upgrades the first night. We were upgraded to a Club Studio room the second night, which was better than the first night. Both rooms were clean but not very impressive in any way.
reviews.title: Very happy stay

reviews.text: The friendliest service we received was from the bellhops who delivered our luggage to our room. The concierge, front desk, and other staff were decent but not great. The bar at the top of the hotel had a great view, but the service was not great. The hotel is huge and hosts a lot of conventions so it is probably difficult to find personalized service.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, some letdowns

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best part of this hotel is the location, which is in the heart of the city and within walking distance of many good restaurants, cafes, and bars.
reviews.title: The old hotel is not worth the cash or points

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Sheraton for two nights during our trip (it was all our budget would allow). We were in the old tower, which was okay, but would have loved to get upgraded to the new tower. At check in, as SPG gold members we were offered an upgrade in the old tower to the SPG floor, but nothing else. We were offered an opportunity to pay for an upgrade to the executive floor, but it seemed expensive for what was available.
reviews.title: Great location, very clean, nice staff, expensive

reviews.text: Our room was very clean and the staff was very friendly. The pool was okay, but I thought it was not nice enough for a hotel with a 5 star rating. The key draw for this hotel is the location, which is unbeatable.
reviews.title: The new tower ,very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My mother ,daughter and i had a very nice three nights stay in the new tower. We booked a studio,but i think we ended up with something better. ... Very nice ,big bedroom for my mum and my daughter, and a big living room ,where they arranged for an extra bed for me. There were actually a total of four tv`s in the room. (two in the living room,one in the bedroom and one small in the bathroom). The lounge is really nice. Good selection of breakfast,afternoon tea,and then from five to eight,free drinks and a good selection of food. After the intense traffic and horn blowing in Ho Chi Minh,it was so nice to get back to the calm atmosphere of the Towers lounge. They also had a good selection of movies for borrowing. Great for my daughter before going to bed... The swimming pool area is a little dark and boring,but the gym looked good and was actually quite busy while we were there. We did not use any of the other restaurants at the hotel ,so this review is basically only for the new tower area. Everything was really nice ,clean and fresh. Lovely ,big towels. Two different kinds of robes in the closet. Quick and nice room service. The location is also very good.
reviews.title: Look forward to staying here each time in HCM City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We’ve stayed at this hotel a couple of times over the past few years and have enjoyed each our experiences on each occasion.
reviews.title: Bad start - good ending!!

reviews.text: We stayed in a Studio room on the club floor in the “new” building (there are two towers – the old one and the new one). The room is very spacious with nice décor including a large plasma tv, small office/work area, and spacious bathroom.
reviews.title: Not up to Sheraton standards; better hotels elsewhere in Saigon

description: Located in the heart of Ho Chi Minh City’s vibrant business and entertainment district, Sheraton Saigon Hotel & Towers is a haven of convenience, connecting you with colleagues and friends. Conduct business meetings in style or enjoy the sights and sounds of the city in our central location.
